name: deviceManagement_UpdateUserExperienceAnalyticsDeviceScopes
description: Update the navigation property userExperienceAnalyticsDeviceScopes in deviceManagement

$block: The user experience analytics device scope entity contains device scope configuration values use to apply filtering on the endpoint analytics reports.

$ul: **id**: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.
**createdDateTime**: Indicates the creation date and time for the custom device scope.
**deviceScopeName**: The name of the user experience analytics device Scope configuration.
**enabled**: Indicates whether a device scope is enabled or disabled. When TRUE, the device scope is enabled. When FALSE, the device scope is disabled. Default value is FALSE.

**isBuiltIn**: Indicates whether the device scope configuration is built-in or custom. When TRUE, the device scope configuration is built-in. When FALSE, the device scope configuration is custom. Default value is FALSE.
**lastModifiedDateTime**: Indicates the last updated date and time for the custom device scope.
**operator**: Device scope configuration query operator. Possible values are: equals, notEquals, contains, notContains, greaterThan, lessThan. Default value: equals.
**ownerId**: The unique identifier of the person (admin) who created the device scope configuration.

**parameter**: Device scope configuration parameter. It will be expend in future to add more parameter. Eg: device scope parameter can be OS version, Disk Type, Device manufacturer, device model or Scope tag. Default value: scopeTag.
**status**: Indicates the device scope status after the device scope has been enabled. Possible values are: none, computing, insufficientData or completed. Default value is none.
**value**: The device scope configuration query clause value.
**valueObjectId**: The unique identifier for a user device scope tag Id used for the creation of device scope configuration.
**client-request-id**: Client request Id as sent by the client application.
**request-id**: Request Id as tracked internally by the service
**client-request-id**: Client request Id as sent by the client application.
**request-id**: Request Id as tracked internally by the service
